modules.description: This module creates and samples linear color gradients between two RGBA or CMYK colors. It provides functions to interpolate between two endpoints using a scalar parameter in the [0,1] range. Use it to generate smooth transitions between colors for visualizations, UI elements, or image processing tasks.

This module manages color palette representations, supporting operations to retrieve RGB/CMYK color values, evaluate accessibility traits (e.g., colorblind safety), and generate sequential gradients for ordered data or diverging scales for bipolar ranges. It works with abstract palette types and predefined schemes like light-to-dark hue transitions (e.g., "ylorrd") or contrasting diverging gradients (e.g., "rdbu"), organized as categorized lists for data visualization tasks such as heatmaps, choropleth maps, or categorical encoding. Functions allow filtering palettes by properties like print/LCD compatibility or class diversity, enabling use cases such as selecting accessible gradients for scientific visualizations or generating dashboard color schemes.

This module provides functions to convert colors between RGBA and integer representations, generate grayscale equivalents, and create continuous color ranges using hue values or gradients. It supports RGBA and CMYK color types and includes tools for building and sampling linear color gradients between endpoints. Concrete use cases include generating color scales for data visualizations, converting hex color codes for graphical rendering, and applying hue-based color transitions to UI elements or charts.
